channel.title: Keyboard
channel.description:
Okay so my keyboard problems started with my spacebar, it was getting really "loose" if that's what you want to call it. I was playing a flash game where you needed to rape the spacebar and it just stopped working. Then I realise it's liftable (was liftable since forever) and it's dirty as shit under there. I clean it up and put the spacebar back on correcty and it still doesnt work, so i give up and call it a night. NOW I was talking on xat chat and now my left,right and down arrow keys dont work, nor do my b and v keys. any suggestions? dont say buy a new keyboard because i am but today was gonna be my busiest day of the weekend and now its screwed. i wont keep using o-sk.
edit; im using on-screen keyboard

item.title: Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @Nathan_R Nathan R
item.description:
@Nathan_R wrote:

rip4d:

Check if the buttons under the keys work. Take off the spacebar and press that little rubber thing down with a pencil. If it works, try repositioning the space bar. If it doesn’t, reinstall the keyboard’s drivers. If that doesn’t work, buy a new keyboard.

Worked, thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Keyboard
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

That’s just normal wear and tear mate, I get a new keyboard every 5 months or so. If you need a cheep one, best buy sells default wired ones for $10.

Read full topic
